article.headline: Manhattan 58, Saint Peter's 51
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Senior center Guy Ngarndi had 16 points and a career-high 17 rebounds to help Manhattan beat Saint Peter's 58-51 on Tuesday night. Antoine Pearson added 11 points and Patrick Bouli and Darryl Crawford scored 10 each for the Jaspers (12-11, 9-4 Metro Atlantic), who pulled into a first-place tie in the conference with Loyola, Md. and Marist. Akeem Gooding had 16 points and Todd Sowell 11 for the visiting Peacocks (3-20, 1-12), who suffered a school-record 15th straight loss. Both teams struggled from the field, with Manhattan shooting just 39.6 percent from the field and Saint Peter's hitting 35.4 percent. Ngarndi and Crawford had six points each to help the Jaspers to a 22-17 lead at halftime. Manhattan led 45-36 after Bouli scored with 7:15 remaining. Kevin Spann's 3-pointer narrowed the margin to 47-46 with 4:38 left, but the Peacocks got no closer.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
